alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 15 at 3:43PM AKST until December 16 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FOR BRISTOL BAY WEST OF DILLINGHAM FROM 5 AM TO NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Visibility of one quarter mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...West of Dillingham. * WHEN...From 5 AM to noon AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are expected along the coast from from early morning to mid-morning Saturday. Visibility is expected to improve during the afternoon hours as temperatures begin to warm and winds diminish.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
